Name: JobPreparationTaskExecutionInformation
SummaryComment: Details about the execution of a <see cref="CloudJob.JobPreparationTask">Job Preparation task</see> on a compute node.

Key.Name: EndTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the task completed.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is only returned if the task is in the <see cref="Common.JobPreparationTaskState.Completed"/> state.

Key.Name: ExitCode
Key.SummaryComment: The exit code of the program specified on the task command line.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is only returned if the task is in the <see cref="Common.JobPreparationTaskState.Completed"/> state. The exit code for a process reflects the specific convention implemented by the application developer for that process. If you use the exit code value to make decisions in your code, be sure that you know the exit code convention used by the application process. Note that the exit code may also be generated by the compute node operating system, such as when a process is forcibly terminated.

Key.Name: LastRetryTime
Key.SummaryComment: The most recent time at which this task's execution was retried by the Batch service.
Key.RemarksComment: This is only returned if the <see cref="RetryCount"/> is not 0.

Key.Name: RetryCount
Key.SummaryComment: The number of times the task has been retried by the Batch service. Every time the task exits with a non-zero exit code, it is deemed a task failure. The Batch service will retry the task up to the limit specified by the <see cref="JobPreparationTask.Constraints"/>.

Key.Name: FailureInformation
Key.SummaryComment: Information describing the task failure, if any.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is set only if the task is in the <see cref="Common.JobPreparationTaskState.Completed"/> state and encountered a failure.

Key.Name: StartTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the task started running. Note that every time the task is restarted, this value is updated.

Key.Name: State
Key.SummaryComment: The current state of the task.
Key.RemarksComment: Running means the task is currently running. Completed means the task has completed. The Completed state includes the case where the task exits successfully with exit code 0 and the cases where the system fails to start the task process due to scheduling errors or the retry limit has reached after numerous task failures.

Key.Name: TaskRootDirectory
Key.SummaryComment: The root directory of the Job Preparation task on the compute node. You can use this path to retrieve files created by the task, such as log files.

Key.Name: TaskRootDirectoryUrl
Key.SummaryComment: The URL to the root directory of the Job Preparation task on the compute node.

Key.Name: Result
Key.SummaryComment: The result of the task execution.
Key.RemarksComment: If the value is <see cref="Common.TaskExecutionResult.Failure" />, then the details of the failure can be found in the <see cref="FailureInformation" /> property.

Key.Name: ContainerInformation
Key.SummaryComment: Information about the container under which the task is executing.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is set only if the task runs in a container context.
